CatDescriptText: Mrs.Lella Williams, 704 North Avenue, West, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1958, pg. 9 with question: "Do you believe in corporal (paddling) punishment for students, in the elementary grades, who misbehave? If so, who should mete [sic]  out the punishment-- the teacher or the principal?" answer reads: �Yes, I think that the teachers should use paddling so that the students will obey.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lella Williams, wearing dark flecked coat with two round buttons, multicolored patterned head scarf, and eyeglasses, standing in front of flecked light colored facade with street sign in background inscribed "turn...am to 10pm..cept Sunday"
